byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and MARGOT SANGER-KATZ

abstract: Hillary Clinton says she now favors 'public option,' which will allow people to buy into Medicare at a certain age, indicating she may be moving to left on health care after resisting Sen Bernie Sanders's calls for single-payer system; shift points to continued influence of Sanders's presidential campaign on Clinton's, despite fact that he trails her by substantial number of delegates.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton, moving in Bernie Sanders’s direction, came out this week in favor of “the public option,” or allowing people to buy into Medicare.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Takes a Step to the Left on Health Care
headline.print_headline: Clinton Suggests  Giving Medicare a Buy-In Option

snippet: Mrs. Clinton, moving in Bernie Sanders’s direction, came out this week in favor of “the public option,” or allowing people to buy into Medicare.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
